title: Doubts raised over Park City Group (PCTG) subsidiary’s ability to continue as going concern-PCYG-
text:
Stock in Park City Group ( AMX:PCYG , Forum ) slid hard in after-hours trading Tuesday following an audit by HJ & Associates that stated the company’s numbers raise “substantial doubt about the company’s ability to continue as a going concern.”
Park City, which goes by the tagline "Sell more, Stock less and See everything,” only acquired the ReposiTrak unit in late June, which provides compliance software for the food and medical industries.
According to the audit, “During the year ended June 30, 2015, the Company had a net loss of $3.1 million, negative cash flow from operations of $3.1 million, and negative working capital of $3.9 million. Historically the Company has had operating losses, negative cash flows from operations, and working capital deficiencies.”
It continued, “Whether, and when, the Company can attain profitability and positive cash flows from operations is uncertain. The Company is also uncertain whether it can obtain financing to complete the rollout of its business plan. These uncertainties cast significant doubt upon the Company’s ability to continue as a going concern.”
The lack of capital wasn’t news to Park City, which had partnered with Leavitt Partners in the venture, who were eventually willing to give up 75% of the partnership for just $100,000.
Park City had lingered for a long period before finally taking up the controlling interest of the company, presumably because it would force consolidation (and revelation) of its financial statements.
The HJ & Associates audit is the result of that consolidation.
Certainly the $197.1m market cap company has the ability to finance ReposiTrak for an extended period while it finds an audience. The company boasted 3,000 supplier connections as of a few days ago.
HJ & Associates says, “The Company will need to raise capital in order to fund its operations.”
Park City Group stock dropped to $9 from $10.95 in after-hours trading.
